fish_species.name: Rainbow Trout
fish_species.description: Rainbow trout are freshwater fish characterized by a colorful stripe running along their bodies. They are popular game fish known for their fighting ability.
fish_species.fishing_method: Rainbow trout can be caught using various methods including fly fishing, spinning, and bait fishing. They are often found in streams, rivers, and lakes.

fish_species.name: Atlantic Salmon
fish_species.description: Atlantic salmon are anadromous fish that live in both freshwater and saltwater. They have a distinctive silver-blue coloration and are highly prized for their flavor.
fish_species.fishing_method: Fishing for Atlantic salmon can be done using fly fishing, spinning, or trolling techniques. They are often found in rivers and coastal areas during their spawning runs.

fish_species.name: Bluegill
fish_species.description: Bluegill, also known as bream, are freshwater fish with striking blue and green coloration on their gill covers. They are popular panfish among anglers.
fish_species.fishing_method: Bluegill are often caught using small hooks and bait such as worms or insects. They are commonly found in lakes, ponds, and slow-moving rivers.

fish_species.name: Largemouth Bass
fish_species.description: Largemouth bass are predatory freshwater fish known for their large mouths and aggressive feeding behavior. They are prized by anglers for their fighting ability.
fish_species.fishing_method: Largemouth bass are often caught using artificial lures such as crankbaits, spinnerbaits, and plastic worms. They are commonly found in lakes, ponds, and rivers with abundant cover.

fish_species.name: Yellow Perch
fish_species.description: Yellow perch are freshwater fish with distinctive yellow coloration and vertical stripes. They are popular among anglers for their delicious taste.
fish_species.fishing_method: Yellow perch are often caught using small jigs or live bait such as minnows or worms. They are commonly found in lakes, ponds, and slow-moving rivers.

fish_species.name: Chinook Salmon
fish_species.description: Chinook salmon, also known as king salmon, are the largest species of Pacific salmon. They are prized for their size and flavor.
fish_species.fishing_method: Chinook salmon are often caught using trolling or mooching techniques in coastal waters. They are commonly found in the Pacific Ocean and its tributaries during their spawning runs.

fish_species.name: Tuna
fish_species.description: Tuna are large and fast saltwater fish known for their streamlined bodies and powerful swimming abilities. They are highly sought after for sport fishing and commercial harvesting.
fish_species.fishing_method: Tuna are often caught using trolling, chunking, or casting techniques in open waters. They are found in both coastal and offshore habitats.

fish_species.name: Clownfish
fish_species.description: Clownfish are small tropical marine fish known for their vibrant orange and white coloration. They are often associated with coral reefs and sea anemones.
fish_species.fishing_method: Clownfish are not typically targeted by anglers due to their popularity in aquarium trade. They are commonly found in coral reef habitats.

fish_species.name: Angelfish
fish_species.description: Angelfish are brightly colored tropical fish known for their distinctive shape and graceful movements. They are popular aquarium fish.
fish_species.fishing_method: Angelfish are not typically targeted by anglers due to their popularity in aquarium trade. They are commonly found in coral reef habitats.

fish_species.name: Deep Sea Anglerfish
fish_species.description: Deep sea anglerfish are bizarre-looking fish with a bioluminescent lure dangling from their heads. They inhabit the deep ocean and are rarely encountered by humans.
fish_species.fishing_method: Deep sea anglerfish are not targeted by recreational anglers due to their deep-sea habitat and specialized adaptations.

fish_species.name: Giant Squid
fish_species.description: Giant squid are enormous cephalopods that inhabit the deep ocean. They are elusive creatures known for their enormous size and mysterious behavior.
fish_species.fishing_method: Giant squid are not typically caught by anglers due to their deep-sea habitat and rarity.

fish_species.name: Gulper Eel
fish_species.description: Gulper eels are deep-sea fish with elongated bodies and enormous mouths. They are capable of swallowing prey much larger than themselves.
fish_species.fishing_method: Gulper eels are not targeted by recreational anglers due to their deep-sea habitat and specialized adaptations.

fish_species.name: Hatchetfish
fish_species.description: Hatchetfish are small deep-sea fish with flattened bodies and luminous organs. They are found in mesopelagic and bathypelagic zones.
fish_species.fishing_method: Hatchetfish are not targeted by recreational anglers due to their deep-sea habitat and specialized adaptations.

fish_species.name: Viperfish
fish_species.description: Viperfish are deep-sea fish known for their elongated bodies and large mouths filled with sharp teeth. They are found in the bathypelagic zone.
fish_species.fishing_method: Viperfish are not targeted by recreational anglers due to their deep-sea habitat and specialized adaptations.

fish_species.name: Blobfish
fish_species.description: Blobfish are deep-sea fish with gelatinous bodies and a distinctive droopy appearance. They inhabit the deep ocean at depths of up to 4,000 feet.
fish_species.fishing_method: Blobfish are not targeted by recreational anglers due to their deep-sea habitat and specialized adaptations.

fish_species.name: Fangtooth Fish
fish_species.description: Fangtooth fish are deep-sea fish with large, sharp teeth and elongated bodies. They are among the deepest-dwelling fish species.
fish_species.fishing_method: Fangtooth fish are not targeted by recreational anglers due to their deep-sea habitat and specialized adaptations.

fish_species.name: Grenadier
fish_species.description: Grenadiers are deep-sea fish with elongated bodies and large eyes. They are found in deep waters worldwide and are often scavengers.
fish_species.fishing_method: Grenadiers are not targeted by recreational anglers due to their deep-sea habitat and specialized adaptations.

fish_species.name: Barreleye
fish_species.description: Barreleye fish are deep-sea fish with transparent heads and tubular eyes. They are found in the mesopelagic zone and are rarely seen by humans.
fish_species.fishing_method: Barreleye fish are not targeted by recreational anglers due to their deep-sea habitat and specialized adaptations.

fish_species.name: Platies
fish_species.description: Platies are colorful freshwater fish known for their lively behavior and easy care requirements. They are popular aquarium fish.
fish_species.fishing_method: Platies are not typically targeted by anglers as they are mainly kept in aquariums.

fish_species.name: Guppy
fish_species.description: Guppies are small and colorful freshwater fish known for their prolific breeding habits and vibrant coloration. They are popular aquarium fish.
fish_species.fishing_method: Guppies are not typically targeted by anglers as they are mainly kept in aquariums.

fish_species.name: Cory Catfish
fish_species.description: Cory catfish, also known as Corydoras, are small freshwater catfish known for their peaceful nature and bottom-dwelling behavior. They are popular aquarium fish.
fish_species.fishing_method: Cory catfish are not typically targeted by anglers as they are mainly kept in aquariums.

fish_species.name: Seahorse
fish_species.description: Seahorses are unique marine fish known for their upright posture and prehensile tails. They are often found in shallow coastal waters among seagrass beds.
fish_species.fishing_method: Seahorses are not targeted by anglers due to their protected status and delicate nature.

fish_species.name: Blue Line Grouper
fish_species.description: Blue line grouper, also known as blue line rockcod, are reef-associated fish found in the Indo-Pacific region. They are prized by anglers for their size and flavor.
fish_species.fishing_method: Blue line grouper are often caught using bait and lures near coral reefs and rocky outcrops. They are known for their strong fighting ability.
